CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 30, 1949, pg. 1, reads: "Unusual Rites - Complying with instructions in last will of the late Charles McDonald Williams, his cremated remains were 'committed to the winds.' The final ceremony took place on the eastern side of Smithfield Street bridge Tuesday, with his brother, Stanley Williams, and Mortician Thomas L. West participating. - Harris Photo."Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, May 7, 1949, pg. 5, reads: "'To the Winds' - Complying with instructions in the last will of the late Charles McDonald Williams, Pittsburgh (Pa.) bartender, his cremated remains were 'committed to the winds.' The final ceremony took place on the eastern side of Smithfield Street Bridge last week with his brother, Stanley Williams, and Mortician Thomas L. West participating. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Stanley Williams throwing flowers into Monongahela River from Smithfield Street bridge, in honor of his brother, Charles McDonald Williams, with Thomas L. West standing beside him
